Package boundary.managerview

Class ManagerEnquiriesView

  • java.lang.Object
    • boundary.managerview.ManagerEnquiriesView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDisplayable
    public class ManagerEnquiriesView
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDisplayable
    Boundary class for handling and displaying enquiry management functionality for managers. This view allows managers to view, filter, and reply to enquiries submitted by applicants regarding the BTO projects they manage.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ManagerEnquiriesView()
      Default constructor that initializes the view with a new scanner and controller.
      ManagerEnquiriesView​(Manager manager)
      Constructor that initializes the view with a specified manager

    • Constructor Detail

      • ManagerEnquiriesView

        public ManagerEnquiriesView​(Manager manager)
        Constructor that initializes the view with a specified manager
        Parameters:
        manager - The Manager entity who will be using this view

      • ManagerEnquiriesView

        public ManagerEnquiriesView()
        Default constructor that initializes the view with a new scanner and controller. Does not set a current manager - this must be set separately before use.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the main menu for enquiry management and handles user interaction. Provides options to view all enquiries, view project-specific enquiries, reply to enquiries, or return to the main manager menu.
        Specified by:
        display in interface IDisplayable

      • setCurrentManager

        public void setCurrentManager​(Manager currentManager)
        Sets the current manager for this view.
        Parameters:
        currentManager - The Manager entity to set as the current user

      • setManagerController

        public void setManagerController​(ManagerController managerController)
        Sets the manager controller for this view.
        Parameters:
        managerController - The ManagerController to handle business logic

      • getCurrentManager

        public Manager getCurrentManager()
        Gets the current manager entity.
        Returns:
        The Manager entity who is currently using this view

      • getManagerController

        public ManagerController getManagerController()
        Gets the current manager controller.
        Returns:
        The ManagerController used by this view
